required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Sotrovimab as Pre-exposure Prophylaxis for COVID-19 in Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Recipients, COVIDMAB Study
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of a SARS-CoV-2 Monoclonal Antibody in Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Recipients (COVIDMAB)

brief_summary.textblock: This phase I trial studies the process by which sotrovimab is absorbed, distributed, metabolized, and eliminated by the body (pharmacokinetics) in hematopoietic stem cell transplant recipients. Sotrovimab is a monoclonal antibody that may target and bind to a specific protein on SARS-CoV-2 and block its viral attachment and entry into human cells. This may slow the progression of the disease and accelerate recovery, and may potentially provide temporary protection against infection with SARS-CoV-2 in hematopoietic stem cell transplant recipients.

detailed_description.textblock:
OUTLINE:
Patients receive sotrovimab intravenously (IV) over 30 minutes within 1-7 days prior to the start of pre-transplant conditioning.
After completion of study treatment, patients are followed up for 24 weeks.

primary_outcome.description: Will use descriptive statistics. Levels of VIR-7831 can be measured using an idiotypic antibody assay that is not affected by COVID-19 infection or vaccination.
Will be calculated by a one-phase exponential decay model. Will compare fold-changes in antibody titers by normalizing to pre-transplant levels for each subject.

secondary_outcome.measure: Half-life of VIR-7831 in matched versus mis-matched donors
secondary_outcome.description: Comparisons will be tested using a t-test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Half-life of VIR-7831 in autologous vs allogeneic HCT
secondary_outcome.description: Comparisons will be tested using a t-test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Half-life of VIR-7831 in patients with diarrhea vs no diarrhea
secondary_outcome.description: Comparisons will be tested using a t-test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Half-life of VIR-7831 in patients with and without graft versus host disease
secondary_outcome.description: Comparisons will be tested using a t-test.
Will monitor for breakthrough SARS-CoV-2 infection by polymerase chain reaction of fluid collected by nasal swabs.
Will compare antibody levels from serum/plasma collected by venipuncture versus self-collected using a TASSO device and fluid from nasal swabs.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 12, 16, 20 and 24 weeks (and week 40 if positive at week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: Will monitor for anti-drug antibody levels from serum/plasma collected by venipuncture versus self-collected using a TASSO device
Will monitor safety with routine labs as part of standard post-transplant care.

arm_group.description: Patients receive sotrovimab IV over 30 minutes within 1-7 days prior to the start of pre-transplant conditioning.

intervention.other_name: Anti-SARS-CoV-2 Spike Protein Monoclonal Antibody VIR-7831

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must be capable of understanding and providing a written informed consent, or, if too ill to give consent, have a legal guardian or power of attorney able to provide written informed consent on their behalf
- Patients must be at least 18 years of age, of any gender, race, or ethnicity
- Patients must be in morphologic remission from their underlying disease prior to transplant (measurable residual disease permitted)
- Patients must be undergoing HCT (any donor or stem cell source, including autologous or cord blood transplant)
- History of prior transplants are permitted
- History of COVID-19, history of vaccination for SARS-CoV-2, positive polymerase chain reaction (PCR) of a respiratory specimen for SARS-CoV-2, or seropositivity for SARS-CoV-2 are permitted
- History of SARS-CoV-2 infection or vaccination of the donor are permitted.
- Post-enrollment vaccination is anticipated and permitted
- Administration of IVIG before or during the study is permitted
Exclusion Criteria:
- Relapse of underlying malignancy
- Signs or symptoms of uncontrolled, active infection
- Pregnant or breastfeeding (this population is generally not cleared for transplant)
- Previous known allergies to any component of the mAb
- Previous anaphylaxis or severe hypersensitivity reaction, including angioedema, to a mAb
- Participants of other clinical studies that preclude the use of other investigational compounds
- Participants who, in the judgment of the investigator, will be unlikely or unable to comply with the requirements of the protocol or unlikely to survive to the end of study

overall_official.affiliation: Fred Hutch/University of Washington Cancer Consortium
